title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 96.1 - Duration of permits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 96.1 - Duration of permits

State Regulations

The duration of the following permits, effective on and
after January 1, 1976, shall be as follows: (a) Solicitors' permits (including annual
temporary solicitors' employment permits), effective for the calendar year
1976, shall expire on December 31, 1976. Thereafter, the term of such permits
shall be three calendar years commencing January 1, 1977 and ending December
31, 1979, and every three calendar years thereafter. (b) Trucking permits shall expire on December
31, 1977. Thereafter, the term of trucking permits shall be three calendar
years commencing January 1, 1978 and ending December 31, 1980, and every three
calendar years thereafter. (c) The
following permits shall have a duration of three calendar years, the first such
period to commence January 1, 1976 and end on December 31, 1978: Section
91. Industrial alcohol permit
91-a. Industrial alcohol manufacturer's permit
92. Alcohol permit
92-a. Alcohol distributor's permit
93-a. Broker's permit
95. Drug store permit
96. Warehouse permit
96-a. Bottling permit
99-b. Miscellaneous permits (annual)
(a) Steamship for ship's stores
(b) Manufacture of products unfit for
beverage use
(c) Hospital permit
for medicinal use
(d) Negotiator's
permit

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
96.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
